content: lucky 7 hat i was in a fickle-type mood when i finally kicked my own arse and boop out came this hat it s pretty simple and straightforward really just some cables separated by knits and purls but i did cross them on the 7th row - and with absolutely no planning or foresight - end up with 7 cables around and 7 cables up hence the lucky 7 hat oh and i also worked the decreases so the cables would stay the same width all the way to the final cross gauge 5 stitches/7 row per inch in stockinette yarn 55-60 grams of worsted weight ~125 yards needles size 7 or whatever floats your gauge boat the type of needles and use of stitch markers are totally up to you they aren t noted here to give you the flexibility to use magic loop two circs dpns whatever you like without having to adjust for my method want full ear coverage go for the brim shown here in size ribbing is forgiving should fit heads in the 21-23 dream in color classy in vino veritas ~56 grams for range maybe more maybe less additional pics please visit knittywhipped blogspot com tips click here for an excellent tutorial by wendyknits on how to cable without a cable needle i m assuming you know how to ssk and k2tog if not check out the great vids on knittinghelp com c6f same as left twist in the tutorial above using a cable needle slip 3 stitches onto a cable needle and hold in front knit the next 3 stitches then knit the 3 stitches on the cable needle pattern cast on 84 stitches and join to knit in the round row 1-10 23 for fold-up brim *k2 p2 repeat from * to end row 11 24 for fold-up brim *c6f p2 k2 p2 repeat from * to end noggin row 1-6 *k6 p2 k2 p2 repeat from * to end row 7 *c6f p2 k2 p2 repeat from * to end works great with variegateds too repeat these 7 row three more times 28 row total shown here in lorna s laces shepherd worsted daffodil ~55 grams crown row 1 *k6 p2 k2tog p2 repeat from * to end 77 stitches row 2 3 *k6 p2 k1 p2 repeat from * to end row 4 *k6 p2tog k1 p2tog repeat from * to end 63 stitches row 5 6 *k6 p1 k1 p1 repeat from * to end row 7 *c6f p2tog p1 repeat from * to end 56 stitches row 8 9 *k6 p2 repeat from * to end row 10 *k6 p2tog repeat from * to end 49 stitches row 11 12 *k6 p1 repeat from * to end row 13 *k5 k2tog repeat from * to end 42 stitches row 14 c6f all the way around row 15 knit row 16 *ssk k2 k2tog repeat from * to end 28 stitches row 17 knit finish break yarn and thread
